definition:
that one                                      
                
                  —used as subject or direct object or indirect object of a verb or object of a preposition usually in reference to a lifeless thing          took a quick look at the house and noticed it was very old            , a plant          there is a rosebush near the fence and it is now blooming            , a person or animal whose sex is unknown or disregarded          don't know who it is
—used as subject of an impersonal verb that expresses a condition or action without reference to an agent          it is raining

—used as anticipatory subject or object of a verb          it is necessary to repeat the whole thing                  —often used to shift emphasis to a part of a statement other than the subject          it was in this city that the treaty was signed
—used with many verbs as a direct object with little or no meaning          footed it back to camp
—used to refer to an explicit or implicit state of affairs or circumstances          how is it going

a crucial or climactic point                                      
             
             this is it
the player in a game who performs the principal action of the game (such as trying to find others in hide-and-seek)
Italian; Italy
information technology
that one just mentioned
—used as the subject of a verb that describes a condition or occurrence
—used in the place of a noun, phrase, or clause that usually comes later
the player in some children's games (such as hide-and-seek and tag) who performs the main action of the game (such as finding or catching other players)

the thing, act, or matter about which these words are spoken or written                                      
             
             I like your jacket. Is it new?

the whole situation                                      
             
             How's it going?
—used as a subject of a verb that expresses a condition or action without a doer          It's cold outside.

the player who has to do something special in a children's game                                      
             
             Once you get tagged, you're it.
in: took a quick look at the house and noticed it was very old
there is a rosebush near the fence and it is now blooming
don't know who it is
beauty is everywhere and it is a source of joy
it is raining
it is necessary to repeat the whole thing
it was in this city that the treaty was signed
footed it back to camp
how is it going
this is it
I like your jacket. Is it new?
How's it going?
It's cold outside.
Once you get tagged, you're it.

definition: used for referring to a thing, situation, place, animal etc when it has already been mentioned or when it is obvious which one you are referring to
used for referring to a baby or very young child when it has already been mentioned, or when it is obvious which one you are referring to
used instead of the subject of a sentence, when the real subject is a phrase or clause at the end of the sentence
used after a verb in place of the object, when the real object is a phrase or clause at the end of the sentence
used for referring to someone’s life, work, or general situation
used for talking about the weather, the temperature, or the light
used for saying or asking what the time, day, or date is
used for saying how large a distance is
used with the verb ‘to be’ for emphasizing that you are referring to a particular person, thing, time, or place
used for telling someone who you are, or asking who someone else is, especially on the telephone
used in some expressions for referring to the thing that you want someone to do
an ability or quality that is needed in order to do something
the quality of being sexually attractive
used for referring to the activity of having sex, especially when you do not want to say this directly
in: I can’t find my ticket. I think I must have lost it.
Don’t do it again.
Her dog was howling at the door, so he let it in.
You should come to Rome – it’s a wonderful city.
If you’d come along and support us, we’d really appreciate it.
Is it a boy or a girl?
It’s nice to be home again.
It’s strange that she never mentioned the wedding.
It annoys me to hear people blaming everything on the government.
It’s always sad saying goodbye to someone you love.
The new law made it easier to get a divorce.
I find it amazing that anyone should want to listen to such rubbish.
What’s it like in the army these days?
He’s been having it pretty easy up to now.
It rained in the night.
It’s a glorious day.
It’s cooler indoors.
It gets dark at around five.
‘What time is it?’ ‘It’s four o’clock.’
It was nearly midnight when we got home.
It was 1985, and Sally had just graduated from high school.
Thank goodness it’s Saturday tomorrow.
It’s about ten miles from here to Plymouth.
It’s your brother I want to speak to.
It was a year ago today that I started working here.
Hello, it’s me, Geoffrey.
‘There’s someone here to see you.’ ‘Who is it?’
Stop it. You’re hurting me.
Jump to it! There’s no time to lose.
Get on with it.
We’ll soon find out if you’re any good as an actor. Either you’ve got it or you haven’t.
She’s definitely got it – the guys are all crazy about her.
They were together all night, but did they actually do it?
it’s not that...it’s just that
it seems/looks/appears
like/hate/love etc it when

definition: used as the subject of a verb, or the object of a verb or preposition, to refer to a thing, animal, situation, or idea that has already been mentioned:
used as the subject or object of a verb to represent a phrase at the end of the sentence:
used to talk about the time, date, weather, or distances:
used for describing things or people that are very fashionable, and everyone is interested in them, wants to have them, etc.:

abbreviation for
        
         information technology
the thing or animal being spoken about, that has already been mentioned:
It is sometimes used to introduce a statement that does not involve a particular event or person:
abbreviation for information technology: the science and activity of using computers and software to store and send information:
companies or organizations that sell or provide goods or services relating to computers, software, access to the internet, etc.:
the department in an organization that is responsible for electronic equipment and services, including computers, software, and internet access:
in: "Where's my pen? It was on my desk a minute ago." "You left it by the phone."
The company was losing money and it had to let people go.
The argument was upsetting for us all - I don't want to talk about it.
Children who stay away from school do it for different reasons.
It's unlikely that she'll arrive on time.
It costs more if you travel before 9.00.
I liked it in Scotland.
I find it convenient to be able to do my banking by phone.
What time is it?
It was October, so it was quite cold.
It rained all day.
It's ten miles to Leeds.
The design of this bag makes it the "it-bag" for this summer.
I can’t find the newspaper. Do you know where it is?
Someone is at the door. Find out who it is.
It’s supposed to rain tomorrow.
Leapfrogging outdated IT is one way that developing nations can beat the industrialized world.
IT consultant/director/manager
IT department/division/staff
IT professional/specialist
The IT industry has the systems to gather and manage more data than the world can produce.
The agency deals with a wide range of jobs in IT.
Take your computer to IT and they'll put a new hard drive in it.

употребляется для усиления какого-либо члена предложения

translated_as@fr: Si tu as jamais fait de la plongée
tu dois savoir à quel point c’est merveilleux.
C’est terrible la façon dont il lui parle.
J’adorais ça quand toute la famille se réunissait.
Cela semble tellement injuste qu’elle ne puisse y aller.
C’est difficile d’élever seule ses enfants.
Je vois qu’il pleut à nouveau.
Est-ce qu’il neige là où tu vis ?
Nous serons en janvier dans quelques jours.
Est-ce que ça fait loin à pied ?
C’est à 500 kilomètres de la côte.
Ça n’est pas pour moi que je m’inquiète

definition: a very funny movie about a few boys and a clown who celebrate together and develop friendship. For children under age of 8.

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
The word the Knights of Ni cannot hear or say.
used in talking about billie eilish breaking records.
A child molesting Clown
The word kids use when they're talking about sex.
